thread.title: Local roundup: Former Woodstock star leads ECSU to title
thread.title_full: Local roundup: Former Woodstock star leads ECSU to title

author: The Bulletin
title: Local roundup: Former Woodstock star leads ECSU to title
text: • Quarterback's return leads Cincinnati over UConn PROVIDENCE — Woodstock Academy alum Emily Becher netted two goals and an assist and the Eastern Connecticut State women’s soccer team clinched its sixth Little East Conference regular season title in 16 seasons with a 7-1 win over Rhode Island College on Saturday. It is the third outright regular season title for the Warriors (12-3-1, 6-0), who clinched the top seed and first-round bye in the conference tournament. Nikki Basilicato also scored twice and McKenzie Reimondo, Maggie Sayers and Tara Shayler added goals. MEN’S SOCCER ECSU 1 R.I. College 0 (2 OT) WILLIMANTIC — Xavier Doran scored his team-leading 10th goal of the season with 1 minute, 43 seconds left in sudden death to lift the Warriors to their fourth consecutive victory. Ryan Murphy made five saves for his sixth shutout in 16 starts to keep Eastern Connecticut State (13-2-1, 5-0-1 Little East) unbeaten in seven home games. FOOTBALL Curry 42 Coast Guard 14 MILTON, Mass. — Bears starting quarterback Derek Victory was forced to exit the game after the first series due to injury, and the offense suffered in a loss to the Colonels. Curry built a 35-0 lead before Coast Guard (4-3, 3-1 New England Football Conference) backup quarterback and former Griswold standout Adam Davis hit Jordan Groff for a 10-yard score. The Bears added another score with time winding down in the fourth on a Colin Cashin 6-yard run. Coast Guard was outgained 533-193 on offense. WOMEN’S FIELD HOCKEY Bridgewater St. 1 MANSFIELD — Jenna Mango and Laura Chicorka scored to lead the Warriors to victory. The win, coupled with a loss by Worcester State, Eastern Connecticut State (9-6, 7-3 Little East) is guaranteed a home game in the Little East tournament for the first time in the 19-year history of the championship. MEN’S ICE HOCKEY Boston University 4 UConn 2 BOSTON — Freshman Max Letunov scored a pair of goals but the Huskies fell to the Terriers in the Hockey East opener for both teams. Rob Nichols made a season-best 28 saves for UConn (2-2, 0-1). WOMEN’S VOLLEYBALL Keene St. 3 ECSU 0 WILLIMANTIC — Allie Luppi had a match-high 14 digs but the Warriors were swept, 25-20, 25-22, 25-16. Adrianna Mihalek and Kay Mullen had nine and eight kills, respectively, for Eastern Connecticut State (11-14, 2-3 Little East). By The Bulletin
